summary: Millions of workers save for retirement via employer-sponsored 401(k) plans. Employers work with service providers that charge fees to manage these plans. The Department of Labor requires the disclosure of fees to employers and workers. We asked relevant organizations about the requirement. They told us that disclosures increased employers' awareness of fees. Some said disclosures may increase workers' knowledge of and involvement in their 401(k)...
title: 401(k) Plans: Reported Impacts of Fee Disclosure Regulations, and DOL Efforts to Support Implementation of Regulations
